channel.title: Daily Briefing Newsletter
channel.description: A daily curated newsletter with weather, news, podcasts, and AI security papers.

item.title: Daily Briefing - Saturday, February 21, 2026
item.description: Weather: 39°F - Slight Chance Light Rain | 5 top news stories | 3 podcast episodes | 5 AI security papers | 4 AI security news
item.content:encoded:
Your Daily Briefing

Saturday, February 21, 2026
☀️ Weather in NYC
39°F
Slight Chance Light Rain
H: 47°  •  L: 38°
A slight chance of rain. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 38. West wind around 10 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%.
Time Temp Conditions Precip Humidity Wind
7am 39°F Mostly Sunny 2% 76% 10 mph W
9am 41°F Mostly Sunny 2% 70% 10 mph W
3pm 46°F Partly Sunny 5% 55% 8 mph NW
5pm 46°F Partly Sunny 0% 55% 7 mph NW
7pm 45°F Mostly Cloudy 1% 62% 6 mph NW
📰 Top News
Sat, 21 Feb 2026 10:09:28 GMT  ·  BBC
Government considers removing Andrew from royal line of succession
Defence Minister Luke Pollard confirmed the government is "absolutely" working with Buckingham Palace on legislation to remove Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor from the royal line of succession, saying it's the "right thing to do" irrespective of the police investigation. Andrew was arrested on Thursday evening, released 11 hours later under investigation for misconduct in public office, and police are expected to continue searching his Royal Lodge until Monday.
 
Sat, 21 Feb 2026 05:25:00 GMT  ·  6abc Philadelphia
Tracking heavy snow in the Philadelphia; blizzard conditions possible near shore | Live Updates
A Winter Storm Watch goes into effect Sunday for the Philadelphia region, with current models projecting 8 to 12 inches of snow for a large area and over 12 inches along some shore points in South Jersey and Delaware. Heaviest snowfall is expected Sunday evening through Monday morning, potentially bringing blizzard conditions, thundersnow, and 50 mph wind gusts along the coast, with coastal flooding and beach erosion likely.
 
Sat, 21 Feb 2026 03:47:51 GMT  ·  Al Jazeera
US military says it attacked vessel in Pacific Ocean, killing three people
The US military's Southern Command (SOUTHCOM) executed a "lethal kinetic strike" on a vessel in the eastern Pacific Ocean on Friday, killing three men it claimed were involved in drug trafficking. This brings the death toll from Trump administration attacks on vessels in the region to at least 148 people killed across 43 attacks since early September. Ben Saul, the UN special rapporteur on human rights and counterterrorism, criticized these actions as confessions to "murder of civilians at sea" and called for accountability.
 
Fri, 20 Feb 2026 23:14:09 GMT  ·  Ars Technica
MAHA moms threaten to turn this car around as RFK Jr. flips on pesticide
US Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. publicly backed President Trump’s executive order Wednesday to increase domestic production of glyphosate, the active ingredient in Bayer’s Roundup, invoking the Defense Production Act. This reverses Kennedy’s 2024 presidential campaign stance where he advocated banning glyphosate, which he called a "likely culprit in America's chronic disease epidemic." Vani Hari, known as "Food Babe" and an ally of Kennedy’s Make America Health Again (MAHA) movement, expressed her speechlessness to The Washington Post over his policy shift.
 
Fri, 20 Feb 2026 22:24:00 GMT  ·  CBS News
Potential blizzard in Boston could drop a foot of snow or more Monday, weather forecast maps show
A major nor'easter, expected to undergo "bombogenesis" off the North Carolina coastline, is forecast to bring 10-16 inches of snow to all of eastern Massachusetts, including the Boston Metro area, along and east of I-95. The storm will begin after sunset Sunday, with the heaviest snow falling from Sunday night through Monday afternoon, potentially exceeding 1 inch per hour. Northeast wind gusts could reach 55-70 mph or higher across southeastern Massachusetts, Cape Cod, and the Islands, causing widespread power outages, roof collapse risk, and coastal flooding.
🎙️ Podcast Episodes
2026-02-21  ·  This Week in Startups
We Asked 3 Experts How to Get More Value out of OpenClaw | E2253
In this episode, Jordy Coltman, creator of WeeklyClaw newsletter, highlighted top time-wasting mistakes for new users and recommended new hardware as the ideal home for OpenClaw agents. Tremaine Grant, Founder/CEO of PulsePLUS, demonstrated his "virtual office" interface and the "Heartbeat Protocol." Jesse Leimgruber, creator of the OpenHome.com smart speaker, showcased his OpenHome AI smart speakers, designed to liberate agents from screens and make them proactive.
 
2026-02-19  ·  This Week in Startups
When Will Openclaw go Mainstream? | E2252
In this episode, Matthew asserted that OpenClaw is not yet ready for the consumer mainstream, contrasting with Ryan's view that it will give consumers new opportunities. Currently, only 10% of individuals possess the technical skills to install OpenClaw, and Anthropic has reportedly patched its pro plan to prevent OpenClaw usage. Ryan predicts a new OpenClaw fork will emerge from the shadows, while Jason expressed skepticism about the OpenClaw foundation's future.
 
2026-02-17  ·  This Week in Startups
Will OpenAI Tank OpenClaw? | E2251
Guests Hiten Shah and Jesse Genet discussed concerns about OpenAI's hiring of OpenClaw creator Peter Steinberger. Jason Calacanis predicted OpenAI will offer everyone personalized closed-source assistants, while Jesse Genet revealed her "non-Slop videos" aggregator app, and that her Mac Minis now outnumber her children due to running agents. Hiten Shah demonstrated live-training an OpenClaw skill based on Jason’s book "Angel" and showcased his OpenClaw-built "personal CRM," and John Arrow discussed his AI Scott Adams clone.
📄 AI Security Papers
2026-02-18  ·  Johannes Bertram, Jonas Geiping
NESSiE: The Necessary Safety Benchmark -- Identifying Errors that should not Exist
safety
The paper introduces NESSiE, the NEceSsary SafEty benchmark for LLMs, designed to reveal safety-relevant failures that should not exist given the low complexity of tasks. This benchmark offers minimal test cases for information and access security, acting as a lightweight sanity check that is a necessary prerequisite for any LLM deployment.
 
2026-02-18  ·  Sasha Behrouzi, Lichao Wu, Mohamadreza Rostami et al.
NeST: Neuron Selective Tuning for LLM Safety
safety
The paper introduces NeST (Neuron Selective Tuning), a method for LLM safety alignment that aims to reduce the computational and storage overhead of full fine-tuning while offering more consistent safety gains than parameter-efficient methods like LoRA. NeST achieves this by selectively tuning specific neurons, providing a targeted and efficient approach to improving LLM safety.
 
2026-02-17  ·  Zarif Ikram, Arad Firouzkouhi, Stephen Tu et al.
CrispEdit: Low-Curvature Projections for Scalable Non-Destructive LLM Editing
The paper introduces CrispEdit, a scalable and principled second-order editing algorithm for LLMs that addresses capability preservation by treating it as an explicit constraint. CrispEdit formulates editing through low-curvature projections, unifying and generalizing existing methods to prevent the corruption of general LLM capabilities while making targeted behavioral changes.
 
2026-02-16  ·  Dongrui Liu, Yi Yu, Jie Zhang et al.
Frontier AI Risk Management Framework in Practice: A Risk Analysis Technical Report v1.5
agentic AI
This technical report, v1.5, provides an updated and granular assessment of frontier AI risks, focusing on the evolving capabilities of LLMs and agentic AI. It analyzes risks across five critical dimensions: cyber offense, persuasion and manipulation, social engineering, autonomous replication and adaptation, and misuse, aiming to identify unprecedented threats from advanced AI models.
 
2026-02-16  ·  Yixin Zhang, Ziyi Wang, Yiming Rong et al.
World Models for Policy Refinement in StarCraft II
The paper proposes StaR (StarCraft II Agents with Refinement), an LLM-based agent for StarCraft II (SC2) that integrates a learnable, action-conditioned transition model into its decision loop. This method bridges a gap by using a world model for policy refinement in SC2's complex, partially observable environment, unlike existing LLM-based agents that solely focus on policy improvement.
🛡 AI Security News
Sun, 12 Oct 2025 07:00:00 GMT  ·  wiz.io
LLM Security for Enterprises: Risks and Best Practices
LLM security is a full-stack discipline protecting models, data pipelines, infrastructure, and interfaces across the AI lifecycle, with risks like prompt injection, training data poisoning, and model theft outlined by the OWASP Top 10 for LLM Applications. Effective security requires best practices such as adversarial training, input validation, strict access control, and secure model deployment to mitigate evolving threats. AI Security Posture Management (AI-SPM) tools are crucial for enterprises to gain visibility, assess risk, and manage the security of their AI assets at scale.
 
Fri, 19 Sep 2025 07:00:00 GMT  ·  Qualys
OWASP Top 10 LLM Risks 2025: Key AI Security Updates
The OWASP Top 10 for LLM Applications 2025, finalized in late 2024, maintains Prompt Injection as the top risk, while Sensitive Information Disclosure and Supply Chain notably climbed the list. New vulnerabilities added include System Prompt Leakage and Vector and Embedding Weaknesses, specifically addressing RAG and embedding-based methods. The list also expanded Misinformation to include overreliance, Unbounded Consumption to cover resource management and operational costs, and Excessive Agency to address risks from unchecked permissions in autonomous AI systems.
 
Mon, 28 Jul 2025 07:00:00 GMT  ·  Fujitsu Global
Next-generation security through AI agent collaboration: Proactively addressing vulnerabilities and emerging threats
Fujitsu introduced Multi-AI agent security technology on July 28, 2025, featuring autonomous AI agents that collaborate to proactively address IT system vulnerabilities and generative AI app security. The "System-Protecting" technology deploys an Attack AI agent, a Defense AI agent, and a Test AI agent, which collaboratively suggest and validate countermeasures in a virtual environment. This approach aims to allow system administrators without specialized security expertise to implement appropriate measures, reducing IT teams’ security workload.
 
Thu, 12 Jun 2025 01:15:38 GMT  ·  TrendMicro
Stay Ahead of AI Threats: Secure LLM Applications With Trend Vision One
The World Economic Forum's Global Cybersecurity Outlook 2025 reports that only 37% of organizations assess AI tools' security before deployment, indicating a major security gap. Trend Micro's Trend Vision One™ platform offers integrated protection addressing nine of the OWASP Top 10 LLM risks (2025) across various environments. Its components include ZTSA AI Secure Access to control and inspect traffic to AI services, and AI Security Posture Management (AI-SPM) for detecting misconfigurations and unauthorized access in AI-related cloud assets.
Generated automatically · Subscribe via RSS

item.title: Daily Briefing - Friday, February 20, 2026
item.description: Weather: 41°F - Slight Chance Light Rain | 5 top news stories | 3 podcast episodes | 5 AI security papers | 4 AI security news
item.content:encoded:
Your Daily Briefing

Friday, February 20, 2026
☀️ Weather in NYC
41°F
Slight Chance Light Rain
H: 42°  •  L: 38°
A slight chance of rain. Cloudy. Low around 38, with temperatures rising to around 41 overnight. Northeast wind around 13 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%.
Time Temp Conditions Precip Humidity Wind
7am 42°F Light Rain 100% 79% 14 mph E
9am 40°F Light Rain 100% 85% 14 mph E
3pm 40°F Light Rain 84% 85% 13 mph NE
5pm 42°F Chance Light Rain 39% 79% 10 mph NE
7pm 42°F Slight Chance Light Rain 20% 79% 8 mph NE
📰 Top News
Fri, 20 Feb 2026 05:45:43 GMT  ·  BBC
Trump says world has 10 days to see if Iran agrees deal or 'bad things happen'
e Middle East, while progress was reported at talks between American and Iranian negotiators in Switzerland. The Iranian government has told the UN Secretary-General that it will regard US bases in the region as legitimate targets if used in any military aggression against Iran. Tehran's UN mission said in a letter to UN Secretary-General António Guterres that Trump's rhetoric signalled a real risk of an attack - but it said Iran did not want a war.
 
Fri, 20 Feb 2026 03:53:02 GMT  ·  The New York Times
New Trump Banner Hung on Justice Department Headquarters
Read more at The New York Times
 
Thu, 19 Feb 2026 22:09:16 GMT  ·  NBC News
Illinois Democrat tries to bleep her way through a tough Senate primary with a new expletive-laden anti-Trump ad
anguage when it airs on TV, according to the campaign. For her part, Stratton does not take part in the cursing. “They said it, not me,” Stratton says as she appears on the screen.
 
Thu, 19 Feb 2026 19:50:25 GMT  ·  The Washington Post
A strong nor’easter could soon hit the East Coast. Here’s what could happen.
Read more at The Washington Post
 
Thu, 19 Feb 2026 16:15:55 GMT  ·  NPR
A Republican plan to overhaul voting is back. Here's what's new in the bill
the bill. Its approval came about 10 months after House Republicans last passed the SAVE Act. The measure, which would transform voter registration and voting across the country, faces persistent hurdles in the GOP-led Senate due to Democratic disapproval and the 60-vote threshold to clear the legislative filibuster.
🎙️ Podcast Episodes
2026-02-19  ·  This Week in Startups
When Will Openclaw go Mainstream? | E2252
In This Week in Startups E2252, Matthew asserted that Openclaw is not ready for mainstream consumers as only 10% of people possess the technical skills to install it. Ryan suggested Openclaw could empower consumers with unprecedented opportunities, while Jason voiced skepticism regarding the Openclaw Foundation. Anthropic has reportedly patched the ability to use Openclaw through its pro plan, and Ryan predicts a new Openclaw fork will emerge soon. Additionally, Openclaw's creator Peter Steinberger is moving to OpenAI, not to work on Openclaw, raising concerns he might "orphan" the project.
 
2026-02-17  ·  This Week in Startups
Will OpenAI Tank OpenClaw? | E2251
In This Week in Startups E2251, guests Hiten Shah and Jesse Genet joined Jason to discuss concerns about OpenAI hiring OpenClaw creator Peter Steinberger, with Jason predicting OpenAI will provide personalized closed-source assistants. Hiten Shah live-trained an OpenClaw skill based on Jason's book "Angel", demonstrating practical application. Jesse Genet showcased her "vibe-coded" app designed to aggregate non-Slop videos for her family, noting her Mac Minis now outnumber her children. John Arrow, creator of AI Scott Adams, explained his inspiration for cloning the iconic podcaster.
 
2026-02-14  ·  This Week in Startups
OpenClaw is Our Friend Now | E2250
In This Week in Startups E2250, Ryan Carson showcased AntFarm, his open-source tool enabling AI agents with specialized roles to collaboratively complete complex tasks. David Im presented Clawra, his AI virtual girlfriend designed to learn user tastes and even purchase presents, sparking discussion about programming AI companions. Alex Liteplo demonstrated RentAHuman, a marketplace where AI bots can pay real people in stablecoins for IRL tasks, citing an example of hiring "100 goth girls" to hold signs in Times Square. The episode explored the evolving social and collaborative dynamics between humans and advanced AIs.
📄 AI Security Papers
2026-02-18  ·  Zun Li, John Schultz, Daniel Hennes et al.
Discovering Multiagent Learning Algorithms with Large Language Models
This paper proposes AlphaEvolve, an evolutionary approach, to discover **Multi-Agent Reinforcement Learning (MARL) algorithms**. This method aims to reduce the reliance on human intuition in developing variants for foundational **MARL** families like **Counterfactual Regret Minimization (CFR)** and **Policy Space Response Oracles (PSRO)**.
 
2026-02-17  ·  Xiaoze Liu, Ruowang Zhang, Weichen Yu et al.
The Vision Wormhole: Latent-Space Communication in Heterogeneous Multi-Agent Systems
This paper introduces The Vision Wormhole, a method for latent state transfer in heterogeneous Multi-Agent Systems (MAS). This approach overcomes the inefficiencies of discrete text communication, which causes significant runtime overhead and information quantization loss, thereby improving scalability and modularity across diverse agent architectures.
 
2026-02-17  ·  Chansung Park, Juyong Jiang, Fan Wang et al.
TAROT: Test-driven and Capability-adaptive Curriculum Reinforcement Fine-tuning for Code Generation with Large Language Models
This paper presents TAROT, a Test-driven and Capability-adaptive Curriculum Reinforcement Fine-tuning (RFT) method designed for code generation with Large Language Models (LLMs). TAROT improves the synthesis of algorithmically sophisticated code by incentivizing deep reasoning capabilities and managing the heterogeneous difficulty and granularity of test cases.
 
2026-02-16  ·  Dongrui Liu, Yi Yu, Jie Zhang et al.
Frontier AI Risk Management Framework in Practice: A Risk Analysis Technical Report v1.5
agentic AI
This technical report (v1.5) provides an updated and granular assessment of **frontier AI risks**, focusing on dimensions such as **cyber offense** and **persuasion and manipulation**. It aims to identify and understand unprecedented risks posed by rapidly advancing **AI models**, especially with the proliferation of **agentic AI**.
 
2026-02-16  ·  Yixin Zhang, Ziyi Wang, Yiming Rong et al.
World Models for Policy Refinement in StarCraft II
This paper proposes using World Models for policy refinement in **StarCraft II (SC2)**, a complex environment with massive state-action space and partial observability. This approach integrates a learnable, action-conditioned transition model into the decision loop for LLM-based SC2 agents, addressing a gap where existing agents primarily focus on policy improvement.
🛡 AI Security News
Sun, 07 Dec 2025 08:00:00 GMT  ·  Qualys
LLM Security | Prevent Vulnerabilities & Boost Application Security | Qualys
The global LLM market is projected to surge from $1.59 billion in 2023 to $259.8 billion by 2030, representing a CAGR of 79.80%. By 2025, an estimated 750 million apps are expected to integrate LLMs, with the top five developers capturing 88.22% of 2023's market revenue. LLMs face significant security vulnerabilities including data poisoning, targeted attacks, and response manipulation due to their inherent complexity and open architecture.
 
Fri, 19 Sep 2025 07:00:00 GMT  ·  Qualys
OWASP Top 10 LLM Risks 2025: Key AI Security Updates
The OWASP Top 10 for LLM Applications 2025 lists Prompt Injection as the top risk, with Sensitive Information Disclosure and Supply Chain climbing to second and third place respectively from 2023. New entries include System Prompt Leakage, which highlights how embedded information in prompts can compromise confidentiality, and Vector and Embedding Weaknesses, focusing on vulnerabilities in Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG). The list also expanded Misinformation to include Overreliance, and Unbounded Consumption now covers resource management and unexpected operational costs beyond just Denial of Service.
 
Mon, 28 Jul 2025 07:00:00 GMT  ·  Fujitsu Global
Next-generation security through AI agent collaboration: Proactively addressing vulnerabilities and emerging threats
Fujitsu has developed Multi-AI agent security technology to proactively counter cyberattacks and vulnerabilities within generative AI apps, published on July 28, 2025. This technology employs three distinct AI agents: an Attack AI agent that creates attack scenarios, a Defense AI agent that proposes countermeasures, and a Test AI agent that simulates attacks in a virtual environment. The system comprises "System-Protecting" Security AI Agent Technology and "Generative AI-Protecting" Generative AI Security Enhancement Technology.
 
Thu, 12 Jun 2025 01:15:38 GMT  ·  TrendMicro
Stay Ahead of AI Threats: Secure LLM Applications With Trend Vision One
Only 37% of organizations have processes to assess the security of AI tools before deployment, according to the World Economic Forum's Global Cybersecurity Outlook 2025. Trend Micro's Trend Vision One™ platform addresses nine of the OWASP Top 10 LLM Risks (2025), integrating features like ZTSA AI Secure Access to inspect traffic to AI services. Its AI Application Security includes an AI Scanner for risk detection and AI Guard to block attacks such as prompt injection and data leakage.
Generated automatically · Subscribe via RSS

item.title: Daily Briefing - Thursday, February 19, 2026
item.description: Weather: 39°F - Cloudy | 5 top news stories | 4 podcast episodes | 5 AI security papers | 4 AI security news
item.content:encoded:
Your Daily Briefing

Thursday, February 19, 2026
☀️ Weather in NYC
39°F
Cloudy
H: 42°  •  L: 38°
Areas of fog before 4am. Cloudy, with a low around 38. Northeast wind around 9 mph.
Time Temp Conditions Precip Humidity Wind
7am 38°F Cloudy 0% 79% 8 mph NE
9am 38°F Cloudy 0% 73% 8 mph NE
3pm 41°F Cloudy 0% 62% 8 mph E
5pm 42°F Cloudy 1% 60% 8 mph E
7pm 40°F Cloudy 5% 67% 8 mph E
📰 Top News
Thu, 19 Feb 2026 08:52:00 GMT  ·  Associated Press News
Former South Korean President Yoon receives life sentence for imposing martial law
ng martial law and sending troops to surround the National Assembly on Dec. 3, 2024. Judge Jee Kui-youn of the Seoul Central District Court said he found Yoon guilty of rebellion for mobilizing military and police forces in an illegal attempt to seize the liberal-led Assembly, arrest politicians and establish unchecked power for a “considerable” time.
 
Thu, 19 Feb 2026 06:37:00 GMT  ·  The Washington Post
Bowser declares Potomac sewage spill an emergency, seeks federal aid for cleanup
Read more at The Washington Post
 
Thu, 19 Feb 2026 04:03:49 GMT  ·  Politico
Bernie Sanders rallies support for wealth tax in California: ‘Enough is enough’
Read more at Politico
 
Thu, 19 Feb 2026 03:59:00 GMT  ·  CBS News
Trump administration gives ICE broader powers to detain legal refugees, citing security concerns
al court filing on Wednesday, instructs ICE to detain refugees who entered the U. S. lawfully but who have not formally obtained permanent residency — also known as green card — a year after their admission.
 
Thu, 19 Feb 2026 00:49:46 GMT  ·  STLPR
Boeing defense headquarters to return to St. Louis after leaving the area in 2017
ith teammates in the area. “The headquarters move, coupled with our senior leaders being based at and spending their time at major engineering, production and manufacturing centers across the U. S.
🎙️ Podcast Episodes
2026-02-19  ·  This Week in Startups
When Will Openclaw go Mainstream? | E2252
Matthew believes Openclaw isn't ready for consumers, estimating only 10% of people are technical enough to install it, while Ryan sees it opening new opportunities. Jason demonstrated his "Clawpod" workflow and expressed skepticism about the Openclaw foundation, hoping for a multi-model future despite a lack of progress. Anthropic has patched the ability to use Openclaw through its pro plan, and Ryan predicts a new Openclaw fork will emerge. The hosts discussed whether Openclaw would be better as a baked-in feature or an app, with the killer use case still undefined, and the impact of Peter Steinberger going to OpenAI.
 
2026-02-17  ·  This Week in Startups
Will OpenAI Tank OpenClaw? | E2251
Guests Hiten Shah and Jesse Genet discussed concerns about OpenAI hiring OpenClaw creator Peter Steinberger, with Jason offering optimistic and pessimistic takes on the acquisition. Jesse shared her app, which "vibe-coded" non-Slop videos for her family, and Hiten demonstrated a "personal CRM" he built using OpenClaw to train a skill based on Jason's book "Angel." John Arrow, creator of AI Scott Adams, explained his inspiration and discussed the legal and ethical considerations of posthumous AI clones. The panel emphasized being in an "appless world" where markdown files are ideal for humans and AI agents, and discussed how companies might "hijack" OpenClaw via hosting and skills.
 
2026-02-14  ·  This Week in Startups
OpenClaw is Our Friend Now | E2250
Ryan Carson introduced AntFarm, his open-source tool for collaborative AI agents with specialized roles working together on complex tasks. David Im showcased Clawra, an AI virtual girlfriend that learns preferences, buys presents, and raises questions about introducing it to an IRL girlfriend. Alex Liteplo presented RentAHuman, a marketplace where AI agents pay real people in stablecoins to complete IRL tasks, such as hiring 100 goth girls to hold signs in Times Square. The hosts also discussed the security implications of AI companions and pondered whether robots could be better bosses than humans.
 
2026-02-12  ·  This Week in Startups
Why J-Cal Invested to 200K in a former Employee | E2249
Jason invested $200,000 in Presh’s startup, The Wellness Company, which developed the Tempo app for monitoring health and offering proactive advice. Presh detailed how Tempo finds engagement and emphasized the importance of Product Velocity and World-Class Design. Peter Cetale presented Sourcerer, a company that uses AI agents to help U.S. firms and distributors find better prices for mass-produced goods, successfully bringing costs down. Peter discussed his experience in a16z’s Speedrun accelerator, noting the impact of Tariff Mania on his business and his belief in leaner startups with cheaper compute.
📄 AI Security Papers
2026-02-18  ·  Shen Zhou Hong, Alex Kleinman, Alyssa Mathiowetz et al.
Measuring Mid-2025 LLM-Assistance on Novice Performance in Biology
A pre-registered, investigator-blinded, randomized controlled trial (June-August 2025; n = 153) evaluated whether LLMs improve novice performance in tasks modeling a viral reverse genetics workflow.
 
2026-02-18  ·  Mingjia Shi, Yinhan He, Yaochen Zhu et al.
Saliency-Aware Multi-Route Thinking: Revisiting Vision-Language Reasoning
The paper highlights that while additional inference computation helps LLMs, similar scaling is challenging in VLMs because visual inputs are typically provided only once, leading to increasingly text-dominated reasoning.
 
2026-02-18  ·  Shruti Joshi, Aaron Mueller, David Klindt et al.
Causality is Key for Interpretability Claims to Generalise
The paper posits that causal inference is crucial for validating claims of interpretability in LLMs, specifically using Pearl's causal hierarchy to define valid mappings from model activations to invariant high-level structures.
 
2026-02-17  ·  Xiaoze Liu, Ruowang Zhang, Weichen Yu et al.
The Vision Wormhole: Latent-Space Communication in Heterogeneous Multi-Agent Systems
This paper introduces a method for latent state transfer in heterogeneous Multi-Agent Systems (MAS), addressing the inefficiency of discrete text communication by enabling high-bandwidth, scalable, and modular communication across diverse architectures.
 
2026-02-12  ·  Julia Belikova, Danila Rozhevskii, Dennis Svirin et al.
Detecting Overflow in Compressed Token Representations for Retrieval-Augmented Generation
This paper defines token overflow in soft compression architectures for LLMs as the point where compression begins to erase task-relevant content, identifying a critical limit for extending effective context length in resource-constrained environments.
🛡 AI Security News
Mon, 09 Feb 2026 08:00:00 GMT  ·  The Hacker News
⚡ Weekly Recap: AI Skill Malware, 31Tbps DDoS, Notepad++ Hack, LLM Backdoors and More
OpenClaw partnered with Google's VirusTotal to scan skills uploaded to ClawHub after cybersecurity concerns rose regarding prompt injections and data exfiltration in autonomous AI tools. Trend Micro reported malicious actors on Exploit.in discussing using OpenClaw skills for botnet operations, and Veracode found over 1,000 "claw" packages on npm and PyPI by early February 2026. These developments highlight how attackers are abusing trusted updates, marketplaces, and AI workflows, leading to an expanding threat surface.
 
Sun, 07 Dec 2025 08:00:00 GMT  ·  Qualys
LLM Security | Prevent Vulnerabilities & Boost Application Security | Qualys
The global LLM market is projected to surge from $1,590 million in 2023 to $259,800 million by 2030, with 750 million apps expected to integrate LLMs by 2025. Despite rapid adoption, LLMs face security risks like data poisoning, targeted attacks, and response manipulation due to their complexity and openness to external inputs. These vulnerabilities threaten the reliability of LLMs and the protection of sensitive information across industries like healthcare and finance.
 
Fri, 19 Sep 2025 07:00:00 GMT  ·  Qualys
OWASP Top 10 LLM Risks 2025: Key AI Security Updates
The OWASP Top 10 for LLM Applications 2025, finalized in late 2024, updates and adds entries to address emerging AI security risks, with Prompt Injection remaining at number one. Sensitive Information Disclosure and Supply Chain jumped to second and third place, while new entries include System Prompt Leakage and Vector and Embedding Weaknesses. Categories like Misinformation and Unbounded Consumption were expanded, and Excessive Agency now highlights risks from unchecked permissions in autonomous AI systems.
 
Mon, 28 Jul 2025 07:00:00 GMT  ·  Fujitsu Global
Next-generation security through AI agent collaboration: Proactively addressing vulnerabilities and emerging threats
Fujitsu developed Multi-AI agent security technology, published on July 28, 2025, which uses multiple autonomously operating AI agents to proactively counter cyberattacks and address vulnerabilities in generative AI apps. The System-Protecting Security AI Agent Technology includes an Attack AI agent creating scenarios, a Defense AI agent proposing countermeasures, and a Test AI agent simulating attacks and validating defenses. This technology enables system administrators without specialized security expertise to implement appropriate measures against complex system configurations and an increasing number of vulnerabilities.
Generated automatically · Subscribe via RSS

item.title: Daily Briefing - Wednesday, February 18, 2026
item.description: Weather: 37°F - Light Rain | 3 top news stories | 5 podcast episodes | 5 AI security papers
item.content:encoded:
Your Daily Briefing

Wednesday, February 18, 2026
☀️ Weather in NYC
37°F
Light Rain
H: 44°  •  L: 37°
Rain and widespread fog before 1pm, then areas of fog and a chance of rain between 1pm and 4pm, then rain and areas of fog. Cloudy, with a high near 44. East wind around 5 mph. Chance of precipitation is 80%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.
Time Temp Conditions Precip Humidity Wind
7am 37°F Light Rain 81% 92% 3 mph S
9am 38°F Light Rain 81% 89% 3 mph SE
3pm 42°F Areas Of Fog 29% 82% 5 mph NE
5pm 43°F Light Rain 78% 76% 5 mph NE
7pm 44°F Areas Of Fog 53% 73% 5 mph NE
📰 Top News
Wed, 18 Feb 2026 03:12:44 GMT  ·  The New York Times
Trump Bets on Diplomacy Without Diplomats
Former President Donald Trump's foreign policy relies heavily on personal relationships, sidelining traditional State Department diplomacy. His administration notably used Jared Kushner for delicate negotiations, leading to the Abraham Accords without extensive career diplomat involvement.
Wed, 18 Feb 2026 02:49:00 GMT  ·  The Wall Street Journal
‘Woke’ AI Feud Escalates Between Pentagon and Anthropic
The Pentagon and Anthropic are in a dispute over **Claude AI's** refusal to generate content like a Marine Corps recruitment poster due to safety concerns. This has led the Department of Defense to review its existing AI ethics guidelines, intensifying the debate over 'woke' AI models.
Wed, 18 Feb 2026 05:34:04 GMT  ·  The Washington Post
DHS spokeswoman who became a face of Trump deportation campaign steps down
Kathryn Rexrode, a prominent spokeswoman for the Department of Homeland Security during the Trump administration, has stepped down from her position. She was a key public defender of the administration's stringent immigration policies, including actions related to family separations at the U.S.-Mexico border.
🎙️ Podcast Episodes
2026-02-17  ·  This Week in Startups
Will OpenAI Tank OpenClaw? | E2251
Jason predicts OpenAI will offer personalized, closed-source AI assistants to everyone, potentially impacting the open-source community. Guest Hiten Shah demonstrated an OpenClaw "personal CRM" for investors, while Jesse Genet showcased her family media aggregator, hinting at new business models. Additionally, John Arrow, creator of **AI Scott Adams**, explained how his AI clone adapts over time and why it sparked widespread online controversy.
2026-02-14  ·  This Week in Startups
OpenClaw is Our Friend Now | E2250
Guest Ryan Carson presented AntFarm, an open-source tool utilizing specialized OpenClaw agents to collaborate on complex tasks. David Im introduced Clawra, an AI virtual girlfriend that learns user preferences and can buy virtual presents, sparking discussion on AI companions. Alex Liteplo showcased RentAHuman, a marketplace where **AI agents pay real people in stablecoins** to complete **IRL tasks**, like hiring 100 goth girls to hold signs in Times Square.
2026-02-12  ·  This Week in Startups
Why J-Cal Invested to 200K in a former Employee | E2249
Jason invested $200K in former employee Presh Dineshkumar's startup, The Wellness Company, for their **Tempo app**, which monitors health and offers proactive advice. Peter Cetale, CEO of Sourcerer and an a16z Speedrun accelerator alum, leverages AI agents to help US firms find the best prices for mass-produced goods. Sourcerer achieves significant cost reductions by deploying agents on both the supply and demand sides of the market.
2026-02-12  ·  This Week in Startups
How These 3 Founders are building on Open Claw | E2248
Presh Dineshkumar developed Eywa, an OpenClaw Replicant that spies on his emails to track active users and fix bugs in his apps. Sean Liu successfully integrated his Meta Ray-Bans with his **OpenClaw** instance, enabling interaction with visible real-world context. Vishnu created a product to simplify OpenClaw setup and security for non-technical users. Both Vishnu and Sean accepted Jason's $125K investment deal to pursue their OpenClaw projects.
2026-02-12  ·  Lex Fridman Podcast
#491 – OpenClaw: The Viral AI Agent that Broke the Internet – Peter Steinberger
Peter Steinberger, creator of OpenClaw, revealed that the project went viral due to its ability to enable self-modifying AI agents, offering unprecedented user control. He disclosed that both OpenAI and Meta made acquisition offers for OpenClaw, which he declined. Steinberger predicts that AI agents will replace 80% of current apps, fundamentally changing software interaction. He also detailed specific security challenges inherent to **OpenClaw's** system access.
📄 AI Security Papers
2026-02-13  ·  Huanyao Zhang, Jiepeng Zhou, Bo Li et al.
BrowseComp-V^3: A Visual, Vertical, and Verifiable Benchmark for Multimodal Browsing Agents
agentic AI
This paper introduces **BrowseComp-V^3**, a novel visual, vertical, and verifiable benchmark for multimodal browsing agents (MLLMs) that offers enhanced task complexity. It provides a more comprehensive and reproducible assessment of deep search capabilities for autonomous web-browsing MLLMs.
2026-02-17  ·  Zarif Ikram, Arad Firouzkouhi, Stephen Tu et al.
CrispEdit: Low-Curvature Projections for Scalable Non-Destructive LLM Editing
The paper presents **CrispEdit**, a scalable second-order editing algorithm for large language models (LLMs) that explicitly constrains capability preservation. This method unifies existing approaches and successfully prevents the degradation of general capabilities during targeted behavior modifications.
2026-02-17  ·  Yuqi Tian, Robert Paine, Attila Dobi et al.
Decision Quality Evaluation Framework at Pinterest
safety
Pinterest developed a comprehensive **Decision Quality Evaluation Framework** to robustly assess content moderation decisions by human agents and LLMs at scale. This framework addresses inherent trade-offs between cost, scale, and trustworthiness in enforcing evolving content safety policies.
2026-02-17  ·  Max Springer, Chung Peng Lee, Blossom Metevier et al.
The Geometry of Alignment Collapse: When Fine-Tuning Breaks Safety
adversarial safety guardrail
This research reveals that fine-tuning aligned language models on benign tasks can unpredictably degrade safety guardrails because the orthogonality of fine-tuning updates to safety-critical directions is structurally unstable. The authors demonstrate this instability collapses under the dynamics of gradient descent.
2026-02-17  ·  Shiqi Liu, Zeyu He, Guojian Zhan et al.
STAPO: Stabilizing Reinforcement Learning for LLMs by Silencing Rare Spurious Tokens
This paper introduces **STAPO**, a method to stabilize reinforcement learning (RL) fine-tuning for LLMs by silencing rare spurious tokens. **STAPO** prevents late-stage performance collapse and improves reasoning quality by addressing the negative correlation between token-wise policy gradient magnitude and token probability/local policy entropy.
Generated automatically · Subscribe via RSS

WASHINGTON — Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem’s relationship with U. S. Coast Guard officials has become strained throughout her first year leading the department, according to two U.

Iran says potential energy, mining and aircraft deals are on the table in talks with the U.S.
Iran is pursuing a nuclear agreement with the U. S. that delivers economic benefits for both sides, an Iranian diplomat was reported as saying on Sunday, days before a second round of talks between Tehran and Washington.

2026-02-16  ·  Xander Davies, Giorgi Giglemiani, Edmund Lau et al.
Boundary Point Jailbreaking of Black-Box LLMs
jailbreak
Frontier LLMs are safeguarded against attempts to extract harmful information via adversarial prompts known as "jailbreaks". Recently, defenders have developed classifier-based systems that have survived thousands of hours of human red teaming.
2026-02-16  ·  Lukas Struppek, Adam Gleave, Kellin Pelrine
Exposing the Systematic Vulnerability of Open-Weight Models to Prefill Attacks
attack
As the capabilities of large language models continue to advance, so does their potential for misuse. While closed-source models typically rely on external defenses, open-weight models must primarily depend on internal safeguards to mitigate harmful behavior.
2026-02-13  ·  Chen Yang, Guangyue Peng, Jiaying Zhu et al.
Nanbeige4.1-3B: A Small General Model that Reasons, Aligns, and Acts
We present Nanbeige4. 1-3B, a unified generalist language model that simultaneously achieves strong agentic behavior, code generation, and general reasoning with only 3B parameters.
2026-02-10  ·  Zhisheng Qi, Utkarsh Sahu, Li Ma et al.
Benchmarking Knowledge-Extraction Attack and Defense on Retrieval-Augmented Generation
attack
Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) has become a cornerstone of knowledge-intensive applications, including enterprise chatbots, healthcare assistants, and agentic memory management. However, recent studies show that knowledge-extraction attacks can recover sensitive knowledge-base content through maliciously crafted queries, raising serious concerns about intellectual property theft and privacy leakage.
2026-02-13  ·  Aadarsh Sahoo, Georgia Gkioxari
Conversational Image Segmentation: Grounding Abstract Concepts with Scalable Supervision

Your Daily Briefing

Monday, February 16, 2026
☀️ Weather in NYC
34°F
Chance Light Snow
H: 40°  •  L: 35°
A chance of snow before 7am. Partly sunny, with a high near 40. Wind chill values as low as 23. Northeast wind 5 to 14 mph. Chance of precipitation is 30%. New snow accumulation of less than one inch possible.
📰 Top News
Mon, 16 Feb 2026 06:34:02 GMT  ·  NPR
Concerns over autocracy in the U.S. continue to grow
Concerns over autocracy in the U. S. continue to grow As the United States heads toward the midterm elections, there are growing concerns among some political scientists that the country has moved even further along the path to some form of autocracy.
Sun, 15 Feb 2026 21:32:23 GMT  ·  BBC
Bondi criticised after saying all Epstein files have been released
Bondi criticised after saying all Epstein files have been released The US Department of Justice (DoJ) has said it has released all of the files required by the Epstein Files Transparency Act, but lawmakers have argued the release is insufficient. A letter sent to members of the US Congress on Saturday from US Attorney General Pam Bondi and her deputy said all documents held by the DoJ had been released. It contained a list of names appearing in the files.
Sun, 15 Feb 2026 22:52:05 GMT  ·  CNBC

DeepSight: An All-in-One LM Safety Toolkit
safety
As the development of Large Models (LMs) progresses rapidly, their safety is also a priority. In current Large Language Models (LLMs) and Multimodal Large Language Models (MLLMs) safety workflow, evaluation, diagnosis, and alignment are often handled by separate tools.

2026-02-13  ·  Yiran Gao, Kim Hammar, Tao Li
In-Context Autonomous Network Incident Response: An End-to-End Large Language Model Agent Approach
Rapidly evolving cyberattacks demand incident response systems that can autonomously learn and adapt to changing threats. Prior work has extensively explored the reinforcement learning approach, which involves learning response strategies through extensive simulation of the incident.
2026-02-13  ·  Dong Han, Yong Li, Joachim Denzler
Realistic Face Reconstruction from Facial Embeddings via Diffusion Models
With the advancement of face recognition (FR) systems, privacy-preserving face recognition (PPFR) systems have gained popularity for their accurate recognition, enhanced facial privacy protection, and robustness to various attacks. However, there are limited studies to further verify privacy risks by reconstructing realistic high-resolution face images from embeddings of these systems, especially for PPFR.
2026-02-13  ·  Shlomi Dolev, Ehud Gudes, Daniel Shlomo
Bloom Filter Look-Up Tables for Private and Secure Distributed Databases in Web3 (Revised Version)
The rapid growth of decentralized systems in theWeb3 ecosystem has introduced numerous challenges, particularly in ensuring data security, privacy, and scalability [3, 8]. These systems rely heavily on distributed architectures, requiring robust mechanisms to manage data and interactions among participants securely.
